<details><summary>Tool use: **write** • Edit file: src/components/common/ToggleButton.vue</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 139, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,139 @@
- 
+ &lt;template&gt;
+   &lt;button
+     :type="type"
+     :disabled="disabled"
+     :class="[
+       'relative inline-flex items-center rounded-full transition-all duration-300 ease-in-out focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-delft-blue focus:ring-offset-2',
+       disabled ? 'opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed' : 'cursor-pointer',
+       modelValue ? activeClasses : inactiveClasses,
+       sizeClasses
+     ]"
+     @click="handleClick"
+     :aria-pressed="modelValue"
+     :aria-label="ariaLabel || label"
+     role="switch"
+   &gt;
+     &lt;span
+       :class="[
+         'inline-block rounded-full bg-white transition-all duration-300 ease-in-out shadow-sm',
+         thumbSizeClasses,
+         modelValue ? thumbActivePosition : thumbInactivePosition
+       ]"
+     &gt;&lt;/span&gt;
+   &lt;/button&gt;
+ &lt;/template&gt;
+ 
+ &lt;script setup&gt;
+ import { computed } from 'vue';
+ 
+ const props = defineProps({
+   modelValue: {
+     type: Boolean,
+     default: false
+   },
+   disabled: {
+     type: Boolean,
+     default: false
+   },
+   type: {
+     type: String,
+     default: 'button'
+   },
+   size: {
+     type: String,
+     default: 'md',
+     validator: (value) =&gt; ['sm', 'md', 'lg'].includes(value)
+   },
+   variant: {
+     type: String,
+     default: 'mint',
+     validator: (value) =&gt; ['mint', 'celadon', 'raspberry', 'delft-blue'].includes(value)
+   },
+   label: {
+     type: String,
+     default: ''
+   },
+   ariaLabel: {
+     type: String,
+     default: ''
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ const emit = defineEmits(['update:modelValue', 'change']);
+ 
+ const sizeClasses = computed(() =&gt; {
+   switch (props.size) {
+     case 'sm':
+       return 'w-10 h-5';
+     case 'lg':
+       return 'w-16 h-8';
+     case 'md':
+     default:
+       return 'w-12 h-6';
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ const thumbSizeClasses = computed(() =&gt; {
+   switch (props.size) {
+     case 'sm':
+       return 'w-4 h-4';
+     case 'lg':
+       return 'w-7 h-7';
+     case 'md':
+     default:
+       return 'w-5 h-5';
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ const thumbInactivePosition = computed(() =&gt; {
+   switch (props.size) {
+     case 'sm':
+       return 'translate-x-0.5';
+     case 'lg':
+       return 'translate-x-0.5';
+     case 'md':
+     default:
+       return 'translate-x-0.5';
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ const thumbActivePosition = computed(() =&gt; {
+   switch (props.size) {
+     case 'sm':
+       return 'translate-x-5';
+     case 'lg':
+       return 'translate-x-8';
+     case 'md':
+     default:
+       return 'translate-x-6';
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ const activeClasses = computed(() =&gt; {
+   switch (props.variant) {
+     case 'mint':
+       return 'bg-mint';
+     case 'celadon':
+       return 'bg-celadon';
+     case 'raspberry':
+       return 'bg-raspberry';
+     case 'delft-blue':
+       return 'bg-delft-blue';
+     default:
+       return 'bg-mint';
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ const inactiveClasses = computed(() =&gt; {
+   return 'bg-gray-300';
+ });
+ 
+ const handleClick = () =&gt; {
+   if (!props.disabled) {
+     const newValue = !props.modelValue;
+     emit('update:modelValue', newValue);
+     emit('change', newValue);
+   }
+ };
+ &lt;/script&gt;
+ 
```

---


Created a toggle button component matching the design. It includes:

**Features:**
- Toggle switch with a sliding white circular handle
- Color variants: mint, celadon, raspberry, delft-blue
- Three sizes: small, medium, large
- Disabled state support
- Smooth transitions
- Accessible (ARIA attributes, keyboard focus)

**Component location:** `src/components/common/ToggleButton.vue`

**Usage example:**
```vue
<ToggleButton v-model="isEnabled" variant="mint" size="md" />
```

The component is added to the styleguide with examples of all variants, sizes, and states. View it in the styleguide to see the interactive examples.

The toggle uses your design system colors and follows the Vue 3 Composition API pattern used in your project.

---



---


Fixed the ref usage. Refs inside an object aren't auto-unwrapped in templates, so I switched to individual top-level refs. The toggles should work now. Vue will automatically unwrap these refs when used with `v-model`.

_**User (2025-11-16 09:38Z)**_

what do we call the elemetn of a toggle button like that? button and background?

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Ask)**_



---


Common terms for toggle switch parts:

1. **Track** (or **rail** or **slider track**) — the background container the thumb slides along
2. **Thumb** (or **knob**, **switch**, **indicator**, **handle**) — the circular element that moves

In your code:
- The `button` element is the **track**
- The `span` inside is the **thumb**

So you could rename:
- `sizeClasses` → `trackSizeClasses`
- `thumbSizeClasses` → keep as is
- `thumbActivePosition` / `thumbInactivePosition` → keep as is

Common alternatives:
- Track = slider, rail, background
- Thumb = knob, switch, indicator, handle

"Track" and "thumb" are the most common in UI libraries.

---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_



---


Checking the current variant names and common naming conventions:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file** • Read file: src/components/common/ToggleButton.vue</summary>

</details>
</tool-use>

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="search" data-tool-name="codebase_search">
<details>
                <summary>Tool use: **codebase_search** • Searched codebase "What naming conventions are used for component variants in this codebase?" • **14** results</summary>
            
| File | Lines |
|------|-------|
| `src/components/common/BaseButton.vue` | L49 |
| `src/components/common/ToggleButton.vue` | L81 |
| `src/views/StyleguideView.vue` | L89-129 |

| `src/views/StyleguideView.vue` | L164-208 |
| `ts-migration-work.md` | L76 |

</details>
</tool-use>

---



---


Your `BaseButton` uses semantic variants (`'default'`, `'primary'`, `'secondary'`), while `ToggleButton` uses color-based variants (`'mint'`, `'celadon'`, `'raspberry'`, `'delft-blue'`, `'on-celadon'`).

Common approaches:
1. Semantic naming (like `BaseButton`): `'primary'`, `'secondary'`, `'success'`, `'danger'`
2. Color-based naming (current): matches your design system colors

Options:
- Keep color-based naming (matches your palette)
- Switch to semantic naming to align with `BaseButton`
- Hybrid: keep color names but add semantic aliases

Which do you prefer? I can update the component accordingly.

---

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** • Edit file: src/components/common/ToggleSwitch.vue</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 104, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,104 @@
- 
+ &lt;template&gt;
+   &lt;button
+     :type="type"
+     :disabled="disabled"
+     :class="[
+       'relative inline-flex items-center rounded-full transition-all duration-300 ease-in-out focus:outline-none',
+       disabled ? 'opacity-50 cursor-not-allowed' : 'cursor-pointer',
+       modelValue ? activeClasses : inactiveClasses,
+       sizeClasses
+     ]"
+     @click="handleClick"
+     :aria-pressed="modelValue"
+     :aria-label="ariaLabel || label"
+     role="switch"
+   &gt;
+     &lt;span
+       :class="[
+         'inline-block rounded-full transition-all duration-300 ease-in-out shadow-sm',
+         thumbColorClasses,
+         thumbSizeClasses,
+         modelValue ? thumbActivePosition : thumbInactivePosition
+       ]"
+     &gt;&lt;/span&gt;
+   &lt;/button&gt;
+ &lt;/template&gt;
+ 
+ &lt;script setup&gt;
+ import { computed } from 'vue';
+ 
+ const props = defineProps({
+   modelValue: {
+     type: Boolean,
+     default: false
+   },
+   disabled: {
+     type: Boolean,
+     default: false
+   },
+   type: {
+     type: String,
+     default: 'button'
+   },
+   variant: {
+     type: String,
+     default: 'primary',
+     validator: (value) =&gt; ['primary', 'celadon', 'raspberry', 'delft-blue', 'primary-on-celadon'].includes(value)
+   },
+   label: {
+     type: String,
+     default: ''
+   },
+   ariaLabel: {
+     type: String,
+     default: ''
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ const emit = defineEmits(['update:modelValue', 'change']);
+ 
+ const sizeClasses = computed(() =&gt; 'w-12 h-6');
+ const thumbSizeClasses = computed(() =&gt; 'w-5 h-5');
+ const thumbInactivePosition = computed(() =&gt; 'translate-x-0.5');
+ const thumbActivePosition = computed(() =&gt; 'translate-x-[26px]');
+ 
+ const activeClasses = computed(() =&gt; {
+   switch (props.variant) {
+     case 'primary':
+       return 'bg-mint';
+     case 'celadon':
+       return 'bg-celadon';
+     case 'raspberry':
+       return 'bg-raspberry';
+     case 'delft-blue':
+       return 'bg-delft-blue';
+     case 'primary-on-celadon':
+       return 'bg-delft-blue';
+     default:
+       return 'bg-mint';
+   }
+ });
+ 
+ const inactiveClasses = computed(() =&gt; {
+   if (props.variant === 'primary-on-celadon') {
+     return 'bg-white';
+   }
+   return 'bg-gray-300';
+ });
+ 
+ const thumbColorClasses = computed(() =&gt; {
+   if (props.variant === 'primary-on-celadon' &amp;&amp; !props.modelValue) {
+     return 'bg-gray-300';
+   }
+   return 'bg-white';
+ });
+ 
+ const handleClick = () =&gt; {
+   if (!props.disabled) {
+     const newValue = !props.modelValue;
+     emit('update:modelValue', newValue);
+     emit('change', newValue);
+   }
+ };
+ &lt;/script&gt;
+ 
```

</details>

Checking the full implementation of `getAvailableGroups`:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file** • Read file: src/composables/usePlaylistData.js</summary>

</details>
</tool-use>

---



---


Tab order is determined by:

1. **`getAvailableGroups()`** (lines 30-34 in `usePlaylistData.js`) returns `Object.keys(playlists.value)`, which preserves insertion order.

2. **Group insertion order** comes from the Firestore query results. The query orders playlists by `priority` (line 50), but groups are added to the `grouped` object as they’re encountered (lines 59-78).

3. **Result**: The first group to appear in the query results (based on the lowest-priority playlist in that group) becomes the first tab. Subsequent groups follow in the order they first appear.

**Current behavior**: The order is somewhat arbitrary—it depends on which playlist with the lowest priority in each group appears first in the query results.

To control the order, you could:
- Sort the groups explicitly in `getAvailableGroups()` (e.g., by a predefined order or by the minimum priority in each group)
- Add a `groupPriority` or `groupOrder` field to control tab order
- Sort alphabetically or by a custom order

Should I implement a specific ordering?

---

---


Confirming:

1. Groups don't have a `dateAdded` or `createdAt` — they're derived from the `group`/`type` field on playlists, not stored entities.

2. Individual playlists have `createdAt` (per the data structure), but it's not currently extracted or used in `usePlaylistData.js` (lines 70-78). The code only extracts `playlistId`, `priority`, `pipelineRole`, `name`, `type`, and `group`.

3. Albums within playlists have `addedAt` in their `playlistHistory` entries.

To order tabs by creation date, we could:
- Extract `createdAt` from each playlist in `fetchUserPlaylists`
- For each group, use the earliest `createdAt` among its playlists
- Sort groups by that earliest date

Should I implement this?

Implementing tab ordering by the earliest `createdAt` date of playlists in each group:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file** • Read file: src/composables/usePlaylistData.js</summary>

</details>
</tool-use>

---



---


Updating the code to extract `createdAt` and sort groups by the earliest date:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: src/composables/usePlaylistData.js</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 30, lines removed: 3

```diff
@@ -25,11 +25,38 @@
  
    /**
-    * Gets all available groups that have playlists
-    * @returns {string[]} Array of group names that have playlists
+    * Gets all available groups that have playlists, sorted by earliest createdAt
+    * @returns {string[]} Array of group names that have playlists, sorted by creation date
     */
    const getAvailableGroups = () =&gt; {
-     return Object.keys(playlists.value).filter(group =&gt; 
+     const groupsWithPlaylists = Object.keys(playlists.value).filter(group =&gt; 
        playlists.value[group]?.length &gt; 0
      );
+     
+     // Sort groups by the earliest createdAt date in each group
+     return groupsWithPlaylists.sort((groupA, groupB) =&gt; {
+       const playlistsA = playlists.value[groupA] || [];
+       const playlistsB = playlists.value[groupB] || [];
+       
+       // Find earliest createdAt in each group
+       const earliestA = playlistsA.reduce((earliest, playlist) =&gt; {
+         if (!playlist.createdAt) return earliest;
+         const date = playlist.createdAt?.toDate ? playlist.createdAt.toDate() : new Date(playlist.createdAt);
+         return !earliest || date &lt; earliest ? date : earliest;
+       }, null);
+       
+       const earliestB = playlistsB.reduce((earliest, playlist) =&gt; {
+         if (!playlist.createdAt) return earliest;
+         const date = playlist.createdAt?.toDate ? playlist.createdAt.toDate() : new Date(playlist.createdAt);
+         return !earliest || date &lt; earliest ? date : earliest;
+       }, null);
+       
+       // If one group has no dates, put it at the end
+       if (!earliestA &amp;&amp; !earliestB) return 0;
+       if (!earliestA) return 1;
+       if (!earliestB) return -1;
+       
+       // Sort by earliest date (oldest first)
+       return earliestA - earliestB;
+     });
    };
  
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---


Implemented tab ordering by the earliest `createdAt` date of playlists in each group.

1. **Extract `createdAt`**: Added `createdAt` to the playlist data when fetching from Firestore.

2. **Sort groups by earliest date**: Updated `getAvailableGroups()` to:
   - Find the earliest `createdAt` in each group
   - Sort groups by that earliest date (oldest first)
   - Handle groups without dates (placed at the end)

Tabs now appear in order of when the first playlist in each group was created, with the oldest groups first.
